values.Description:
Live Scribe Job Description
About Real Talk Philosophy
Real Talk Philosophy (RTP) is an innovative organization that hosts engaging, interactive events exploring contemporary divisive issues. Since 2017, we've been fostering meaningful dialogues through a unique blend of presentations, discussions, artwork, music, and games.
Role Overview
As a Live Scribe for Real Talk Philosophy, you'll play a crucial role in capturing and visualizing the dynamic discussions that take place during our events in real-time. Your ability to listen, synthesize, and represent complex ideas graphically will enhance the audience's understanding and engagement with the topics being explored.
Key Responsibilities
Real-Time Visual Note-Taking
Create visual representations of discussions, arguments, and key points as they unfold during events
Use a combination of text, illustrations, and diagrams to capture and clarify complex ideas
Ensure that diverse perspectives and nuanced arguments are fairly represented
Digital or Physical Medium Management
Proficiently use digital drawing tools or manage large-format paper and art supplies as required
Adapt to various event setups and technical requirements
Content Synthesis
Quickly identify and highlight central themes, connections, and contrasts in the discussion
Organize information in a logical, easy-to-follow manner
Balance detail with overall clarity to create comprehensive yet accessible visual summaries
Collaboration with RTP Team
Work closely with presenters and moderators to understand event structure and key concepts in advance
Coordinate with the technical team to ensure proper display of live scribing (if digital)
Provide final visual artifacts to the Blog Manager for post-event publication
Audience Engagement
Be prepared to briefly explain your visual notes to the audience if called upon
Create visuals that enhance audience understanding and stimulate further discussion
Post-Event Processing
Refine and finalize visual notes after the event if necessary
Provide high-quality versions of visual notes for archiving and sharing
Qualifications
Proven experience in graphic facilitation, visual note-taking, or similar roles
Excellent listening and information synthesis skills
Strong artistic abilities and visual communication skills
Ability to work quickly and accurately under pressure
Familiarity with philosophical concepts and contemporary social issues
Desired Qualities
Impartiality and ability to represent diverse viewpoints fairly
Quick thinking and adaptability to follow dynamic discussions
Interest in philosophy and current events
Comfort with public speaking (for potential explanations of visuals)
Ability to simplify complex ideas without losing essential meaning
Technical Skills
Proficiency with digital drawing tools (e.g., iPad with Procreate, Microsoft Surface, etc.) if using digital medium
Familiarity with large-format drawing and various artistic media if using physical medium
Basic understanding of audiovisual setups for live projection (if applicable)
Time Commitment and Compensation
Part-time role based on event schedule
Availability for evening and weekend events required
Some preparation time before events and processing time after events
Compensation may include:
Per-event rate
Additional fee for finalized, high-quality versions of visual notes
Performance bonuses based on audience and team feedback
Complimentary access to RTP events when not working
How to Apply
If you're passionate about visualizing complex discussions and have a talent for real-time graphic facilitation, we'd love to see your work. Please submit your resume, a cover letter explaining your interest in the role, and a portfolio showcasing your live scribing or visual note-taking skills. Include examples that demonstrate your ability to capture philosophical or complex discussions if possible.
Real Talk Philosophy is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and volunteers.

values.Description:
Local Chapter Leader (LCL) Job Description
About Real Talk Philosophy
Real Talk Philosophy (RTP) is a pioneering organization dedicated to combating sociopolitical polarization through facilitated intercultural dialogue. Since 2017, we have been hosting engaging, impartial discussions on contemporary divisive issues across the globe. Our events incorporate lectures, small-group discussions, artwork, music, games, and expert Q&As to create a unique, entertaining, and enlightening experience.
Role Overview
As a Local Chapter Leader (LCL), you will be the driving force behind Real Talk Philosophy events in your area. You will assemble and coordinate a local team, oversee event planning and execution, and ensure that each event aligns with RTP's mission and values. This role requires strong leadership, organizational skills, and a passion for fostering meaningful dialogue on complex issues.
Key Responsibilities
Event Planning and Execution
Plan and coordinate regular RTP events in your local area
Ensure events follow the RTP format, incorporating all required elements (lectures, discussions, artwork, music, games, etc.)
Secure appropriate venues for events
Manage event budgets and financial reporting
Team Management
Recruit, train, and coordinate a local team, including presenters, facilitators, front door managers, photographers, and other support staff
Assign roles and responsibilities for each event
Provide guidance and support to team members
Conduct regular team meetings and performance evaluations
Content Development
Collaborate with the Event Resource Development team to adapt content for local audiences
Ensure all presented content remains impartial and aligns with RTP's values
Community Building
Foster a strong, engaged local community of RTP attendees
Manage local social media accounts and marketing efforts
Respond to inquiries from potential attendees and community members
Stakeholder Management
Liaise with RTP headquarters to ensure alignment with organizational goals and standards
Build relationships with local partners, venues, and potential sponsors
Represent RTP at local events and networking opportunities
Continuous Improvement
Gather and analyze feedback from events to drive continuous improvement
Stay informed about local issues and trends to inform event topics
Participate in LCL training and development opportunities provided by RTP
Qualifications
Strong leadership and organizational skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Demonstrated ability to manage diverse teams
Experience in event planning and execution
Passion for philosophy, contemporary issues, and fostering open dialogue
Ability to remain impartial when discussing divisive topics
Proficiency in using technology for event management and communication
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience (advanced degree in philosophy, social sciences, or related field is a plus)
Fluency in English and the primary language of the local area
Desired Qualities
Intellectual curiosity and a love for learning
Empathy and the ability to understand diverse perspectives
Creativity in problem-solving and event design
Adaptability and resilience in facing challenges
Commitment to RTP's mission and values
Time Commitment and Compensation
This is a part-time role with a flexible schedule, requiring approximately 15-20 hours per event
Compensation varies based on location and event performance, potentially including:
Base stipend per event
Percentage of event revenue
Performance bonuses based on attendance and community growth
How to Apply
If you are passionate about fostering meaningful dialogue and have the skills to lead a local chapter of Real Talk Philosophy, we want to hear from you. Please submit your resume, a cover letter explaining your interest in the role, and a brief proposal for how you would establish or grow an RTP chapter in your area.
Real Talk Philosophy is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and volunteers.

values.Description:
Blog Manager Job Description
About Real Talk Philosophy
Real Talk Philosophy (RTP) is an innovative organization that hosts engaging, interactive events exploring contemporary divisive issues. Since 2017, we've been fostering meaningful dialogues through a unique blend of presentations, discussions, artwork, music, and games.
Role Overview
As the Blog Manager for Real Talk Philosophy, you'll be responsible for maintaining and updating our blog with content generated from our events. Your role is crucial in ensuring that the rich discussions and creative outputs from our events are accurately represented and easily accessible to our online audience.
Key Responsibilities
Content Publication
Post pre-generated content onto the RTP blog for each event, including:
Scribe notes
Event photographs
Haiku and drawings created by participants
Artwork related to event themes
Video content from events
Ensure all content is properly formatted and presented consistently
Platform Management
Manage the RTP blog using Squarespace and Coda.io
Organize content logically and maintain a user-friendly blog structure
Ensure the blog is up-to-date and all event-related content is published in a timely manner
Quality Assurance
Review all content before publication to ensure accuracy and appropriateness
Make minor edits or formatting adjustments as needed
Coordinate with content creators (e.g., Scribe, Photographer, Videographer) if any clarifications or adjustments are needed
Archiving and Organization
Maintain an organized archive of all published content
Ensure content is easily searchable and accessible
Basic SEO Implementation
Apply basic SEO practices to blog posts, such as using appropriate tags and categories
Ensure proper metadata is included for all published content
Collaboration with RTP Team
Work closely with other team members to gather all necessary content for each event
Communicate effectively with the team to ensure timely content delivery and publication
Qualifications
Experience with content management systems, particularly Squarespace and Coda.io
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Basic understanding of SEO principles
Excellent written communication skills
Ability to work efficiently and meet deadlines
Desired Qualities
Interest in philosophy and contemporary issues
Commitment to accurately representing diverse viewpoints
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Adaptability and willingness to learn new tools or processes
Technical Skills
Proficiency with Squarespace and Coda.io
Basic HTML knowledge (a plus)
Familiarity with image and video embedding in blog posts
Time Commitment and Compensation
Part-time role with flexible hours
Time commitment based on event frequency and content volume
Compensation may include:
Hourly rate or per-event fee
Performance bonuses based on timeliness and accuracy of publications
How to Apply
If you're detail-oriented, tech-savvy, and interested in helping share thought-provoking content with a wider audience, we'd love to hear from you. Please submit your resume, a cover letter explaining your interest in the role, and examples of any relevant experience with blog management or content publication.
Real Talk Philosophy is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and volunteers.
